dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey B, got some interesting news coming out of the Almaty region.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey B, got some interesting news coming out of the Almaty region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah? What's up? Another, um, new initiative?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah? What's up? Another, um, new initiative?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! So, they've actually introduced a new work schedule there for government institutions. Like, it's been officially confirmed by the regional akimat's press service.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! So, they've actually introduced a new work schedule there for government institutions. Like, it's been officially confirmed by the regional akimat's press service.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A new work schedule has been introduced in the Almaty region. The information was confirmed by the regional akimat's press service.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, a *new* schedule? Um, what's it look like? Are we talking, like, four-day work weeks or something wild?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, a new schedule? Um, what's it look like? Are we talking, like, four-day work weeks or something wild?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Not quite that wild, no. So, starting June 16th, it's gonna be 8:00 AM to 5:30 PM.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not quite that wild, no. So, starting June sixteenth, it's gonna be eight:zero A M to five:thirty P M.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starting June 16, government institutions in the Almaty region will follow a new schedule: the workday will begin at 08:00 a.m. and end at 5:30 p.m.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa, that's a, uh, that's a pretty long day, right? Like, nine and a half hours?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa, that's a, uh, that's a pretty long day, right? Like, nine and a half hours?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it actually includes a specific lunch break in there. It's from 12:30 PM to 2:00 PM. So, like, an hour and a half for lunch.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it actually includes a specific lunch break in there. It's from twelve:thirty P M to two:zero P M. So, like, an hour and a half for lunch.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: with a lunch break from 12:30 p.m. to 2:00 p.m.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, okay, that makes more sense. So, uh, still an eight-hour workday then? [overlaps] Or is it actually longer?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, okay, that makes more sense. So, uh, still an eight-hour workday then? Or is it actually longer?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Yeah, no, exactly. The akimat, um, clarified that it *is* still an eight-hour workday, totally in line with the country's Labor Code.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, no, exactly. The akimat, um, clarified that it is still an eight-hour workday, totally in line with the country's Labor Code.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The akimat (local government administration) clarified that the eight-hour workday remains in place and is in accordance with the country's Labor Code.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, okay. So, it's just, like, shifting when those eight hours happen, and, uh, extending the overall window, I guess?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, okay. So, it's just, like, shifting when those eight hours happen, and, uh, extending the overall window, I guess?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. And they said government agencies will just continue to operate as usual within this new framework.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. And they said government agencies will just continue to operate as usual within this new framework.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Government agencies will continue to operate as usual.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Fascinating. So, just Almaty, or, like, is this a broader trend? Because I swear I saw something, um, about Astana too?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fascinating. So, just Almaty, or, like, is this a broader trend? Because I swear I saw something, um, about Astana too?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Ah, good point! Yes, speaking of Astana, that's actually, um, a *proposed* shift. They're just considering changing work hours there, it's not implemented yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ah, good point! Yes, speaking of Astana, that's actually, um, a proposed shift. They're just considering changing work hours there, it's not implemented yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Major shift proposed: Authorities consider changing work hours in Astana

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Gotcha. So, Almaty region, definite change, starts June 16th. Astana is still just talk.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Gotcha. So, Almaty region, definite change, starts June sixteenth. Astana is still just talk.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A new work schedule has been introduced in the Almaty region. ... Starting June 16, government institutions in the Almaty region will follow a new schedule... Major shift proposed: Authorities consider changing work hours in Astana

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely. Keep an eye on that one, though.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely. Keep an eye on that one, though.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely will. Thanks for the heads-up!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely will. Thanks for the heads-up!
